Name: Granby Colleges of Science and Technology

Topics.Title: Original Name of the Institution
Topics.Content: The original name of Granby Colleges of Science and Technology was Granby Computer School.

Topics.Title: Founders of the Institution
Topics.Content: The founders of Granby Colleges of Science and Technology were Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs).

Topics.Title: Founders' Work During Gulf War
Topics.Content: During the Gulf War, the founders worked in the Middle East. Their primary source of income was a T-shirt printing business.

Topics.Title: Business Dealings Leading to Name
Topics.Content: Granby Colleges of Science and Technology acquired its name from business dealings with British troops.

Topics.Title: Government Agency Approvals
Topics.Content: The programs offered by Granby Colleges of Science and Technology were approved by the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) and the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA).

Topics.Title: First Degree Course Approved by CHED
Topics.Content: The first degree course approved by CHED for Granby Colleges of Science and Technology was the Bachelor of Science in Business Administration.

Topics.Title: Number of Incorporators Required by SEC
Topics.Content: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) requires five incorporators for a corporation like Granby Colleges of Science and Technology.

Topics.Title: Significant Achievement with CHED, TESDA, and DepEd
Topics.Content: Granby Colleges of Science and Technology achieved significant approval from CHED, TESDA, and the Department of Education (DepEd).

Topics.Title: Location of the Institution
Topics.Content: Granby Colleges of Science and Technology is located in the town of Naic.

Topics.Title: Founder's Occupation Before Establishing the Institution
Topics.Content: Before establishing Granby Colleges of Science and Technology, the founder was a farmer.

Topics.Title: Founder's Request During College
Topics.Content: While still studying, the founder requested the college administration to start an Adult Education project.

Topics.Title: Supporters of the Founder's Idea
Topics.Content: The founder's idea of establishing an educational institution was supported by two best friends and colleagues: an OFW friend and a co-educator friend.

Topics.Title: First TESDA Approved Course
Topics.Content: The first course approved by TESDA for Granby Computer Center was a Computer Programming course.

Topics.Title: Event Leading to Relocation
Topics.Content: Granby Learning Center had to look for another space due to a deal with the building owner being pirated.

Topics.Title: Initial Rental of Buildings
Topics.Content: Granby Learning Center initially rented three buildings.

Topics.Title: Reason for Loan Application
Topics.Content: Granby College of Science and Technology applied for a loan due to the need for more space.

Topics.Title: Financing Building Improvements
Topics.Content: To finance the improvement of its building, Granby College of Science and Technology sold a piece of land.

Topics.Title: Department of Education's Plan
Topics.Content: A revision to the K-to-12 program by the Department of Education led Granby to apply for a government permit.

Topics.Title: Founders' Original Business Venture
Topics.Content: The founders' original business venture in the Middle East was T-shirt printing.

Topics.Title: Military Operation During Gulf War
Topics.Content: The military operation that provided income for the founders during the Gulf War was Desert Shield and Desert Storm.

Topics.Title: Business Evolution in Saudi Arabia
Topics.Content: Granby Saudi Arabia evolved from T-shirt printing to computer sales and tutorial lessons.

Lessons.Title: Changes and Suggestions by Government Agencies

Topics.Title: CHED's Suggestion for Name Change
Topics.Content: CHED suggested changing the term 'College' to 'Colleges' in the name of Granby College of Science and Technology.

Topics.Title: TESDA's Suggestion for Legal Status
Topics.Content: TESDA suggested changing the legal status of Granby Computer School to a Corporation.

Topics.Title: Initial Educational Programs Offered
Topics.Content: Granby Computer School initially offered technical and vocational courses.

Topics.Title: Achievement with Department of Education
Topics.Content: Granby College of Science and Technology achieved approval of the K-to-12 Basic Education Program with the Department of Education.

Topics.Title: Motivation for Establishing a Business in the Philippines
Topics.Content: The primary motivation for the founders to establish a business in the Philippines was future planning after leaving Saudi Arabia.

Topics.Title: CHED's Suggested Change for Granby College
Topics.Content: CHED suggested changing the term 'College' to 'Colleges' in the name of Granby College of Science and Technology.
